page.title: 07MANOR FARM
page.content: MANOR FARM,CHILBOLTON IS OWNED AND RUN BY THE PAINTER FAMILY. OLD MR. PAINTER TOOK OVER THE FARM IN 1949. THE FARM COMPRISES 1200 ACRES AND GROWS A VARIETY OF CROPS:-PEAS,POTATOES ,BARLEY,WHEAT, CRESS,BULBS. IT MAINTAINS A SMALL HERD OF 50 BEEF CATTLE. THE PEAS GROWN ARE HARVESTED IN JULY AND ARE EITHER CANNED OR FROZEN FOR FINDUS OR BIRD'S EYE. POTATOES ARE MARIS PIPER AND RECORD,WHICH ARE USED FOR SMITH'S CRISPS. MR.PAINTER OWNS 3 COMBINE HARVESTERS,WORTH Â£30,000 EACH,A POTATO DRYER,TRACTORS,STONE PICKERS,PEA HARVESTERS,AND A BULB STERILISING UNIT. THIS YEAR MR. PAINTER DECIDED TO MAKE SILAGE IN BAGS,INSTEAD OF IN CLAMPS AND IS DELIGHTED TO FIND IT MUCH EASIER AND EXCELLENT FOR FODDER.
